title: Irish Seafood Chowder

ingredients.content: 35 oz mussels, in the shell, rinsed, scrubbed and beards removed
4 ½ oz yellow onions, cut into pieces
20 oz russet potatoes, peeled, cubed (1 in.)
6 sprigs fresh thyme, divided (4 sprigs leaves only, plus 2 sprigs to garnish)

preparations.content: Place Varoma into position, weigh in mussels and set aside.
Place onions and pancetta into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then cook <b>15 min/250°F/speed 1<b>. Drain off excess fat.
Add seafood stock, potatoes, flour, salt and pepper. Place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Set Varoma aside and keep warm.
Add whipping cream, insert measuring cup and blend <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.

Add cod, salmon and thyme leaves and cook <b>5 min/195°F//speed 0.5<b>. Transfer chowder to serving bowls and top with reserved steamed mussels. Garnish with 2 sprigs thyme and serve hot with fresh baguette.

hintsAndTricks: Discard any mussels which are open before cooking and those that are still closed after cooking.
Add 2-3 oz smoked salmon, diced (1 in.) during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
